column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=6. Conclusions
#Text=This paper is devoted to investigating the integrated precise orbit determination with large LEO constellations .
#Text=We performed LEO-augmented multi-GNSS precise orbit determination in this study .
#Text=Based on simulated GNSS observations , several integrated POD schemes are implemented to investigate the performance of integrated POD under different tracking conditions .

#Text=The potential influence factors of the integrated POD , including LEO satellites number , altitude , and orbit type as well as ground station number and distribution , are analyzed and discussed in detail .

#Text=The result shows that joint processing ground observations from the global network and the large LEO constellation onboard observations can significantly improve the orbit accuracy for GNSS satellites , especially for BDS GEO satellites .
#Text=The accuracy improvement percentage with respect to the ground-based POD results can reach over 70 % for all the integrated POD schemes with 60- , 66- , 96-LEO satellites .

#Text=The largest orbit accuracy improvement of over 98 % can be recognized for BDS GEO , since the fast motion of LEO satellites brings tremendous variations to the tracking geometry of GEO satellites .
#Text=By incorporating a large number of LEO satellites , BDS GEO satellites can obtain a centimeter-level orbit .
#Text=Compared with the 60- and 66-LEO schemes , a slightly better orbit quality is observed in the 96 LEO scheme due to the introduction of more LEO satellites .
#Text=However , the increase of the involved LEO satellites results in a sharp rise in the computational time of the integrated POD because of more unknown parameters to be solved .
#Text=We also present the impact of the LEO orbit type on the integrated POD .
#Text=With the same number of LEO satellites , the sun-synchronous-orbiting constellation presents a stronger enhancement to GNSS orbits than the polar-orbiting constellation .
#Text=The improvement can be attributed to the more rapid variation of GNSS tracking geometry provided by a sun-synchronous-orbiting constellation .
#Text=In terms of the LEO altitude , the orbit altitude of LEO satellites is found to have little influence on the enhancement to GNSS orbits except for with BDS GEO satellites .
#Text=Benefiting from the faster motion of lower LEO satellites , the 600 km scheme achieves a better orbit accuracy for BDS GEO than the 1000 km and 1400 km schemes .
#Text=In order to assess the impact of station number and distribution , global and regional networks with different numbers of stations are employed .
#Text=With the inclusion of large LEO constellation , the integrated POD appears to be more sensitive to the distribution of ground stations , rather than the station number .

#Text=This is because in the integrated POD , the dependence of GNSS orbit determination on ground stations is largely reduced by the onboard GNSS observations when a large LEO constellation is considered .
#Text=Based on 8 regional stations , the orbit accuracy of the integrated POD with a sun-synchronous-orbiting constellation is at the centimeter level .

#Text=However , a subcentimeter accuracy can be recognized for the orbits of GNSS satellites when 8 globally distributed stations are adopted , which is comparable to the result of the integrated POD with a denser global network of 65 stations .

#Text=Although GNSS orbit estimations can greatly benefit from the incorporation of a full LEO constellation , the integrated POD suffers from long computation time due to the addition of a large number of LEO satellites .
#Text=To balance the conflict between orbit accuracy and computational efficiency , the integrated POD with a partial LEO constellation is investigated .
#Text=The orbit accuracy of GNSS satellites improves gradually as the LEO satellites increase .
#Text=The more LEO satellites , the better the orbit accuracy .
#Text=However , with an increasing number of LEOs , the accuracy improvement of GNSS orbits becomes smaller .
#Text=Meanwhile , the increase of LEO satellites results in a steep rise in computational time .
#Text=Considering both orbit accuracy and computational efficiency , we prefer 40 LEO satellites in a sun-synchronous orbit .
#Text=With the rapid development of the LEO constellations , we expect an improvement of GNSS POD when jointly processing GNSS observation data from reference sites and LEOs .
#Text=Continued efforts for force modeling , algorithm optimization , and scheme design are required to achieve better performance of the integrated POD .
